title: Eileen Bond's lavish Double Bay apartment hits market | 7NEWS
description: A Double Bay waterfront apartment owned by the late Eileen Bond, wife of controversial businessman Alan Bond, has been listed for $17 million. The eccentric two-storey property with sweeping Sydney Harbour views was purchased by the couple in 1986 for $1.2 million and features four bedrooms, formal lounge and dining spaces, and a lift between levels. The socialite known as 'Red' entertained Australia's elite including Barry Humphries, Bob Hawke and Lady Susan Renouf at the harbourside residence, which is being sold by her children seven months after her death. title: Pope Leo marks beginning of Lent with Ash Wednesday Mass in Rome
description: Pope Leo has marked the beginning of Lent at Ash Wednesday Mass in Rome, saying the ashes placed on believers' heads symbolise "a world that is burning." Christians observe Lent for 40 days of reflection and repentance, culminating in Easter. #pope #lent #mass #catholic #rome

title: Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor arrested on 66th birthday | 7NEWS
description: Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor has been arrested by police at his Sandringham residence on his 66th birthday for misconduct in public office. The arrest follows revelations in the Epstein files alleging the leaking of secrets and trade documents to Jeffrey Epstein from Andrew's own email address. At least seven police officers are investigating allegations related to Andrew from the Epstein files, with misconduct in public office carrying a maximum penalty of life in prison. title: WA child predator receives record jail sentence | 7NEWS
description: A 33-year-old Western Australian man has been sentenced to 24 years and six months in prison for 77 child sex offences against six victims, including a two-month-old baby. The man who was trusted as a babysitter, abused children known to him, with police discovering nearly 18,000 photos and videos during a raid on his home. The District Court described the crimes as some of the most depraved ever seen in the state, with the sentence ranking among the harshest handed down in Western Australia over the past decade. title: Matilda Bay ferry terminal sparks community backlash | 7NEWS
description: A proposed 140-metre ferry terminal at Matilda Bay in Crawley has sparked protests from hundreds of demonstrators who say it will destroy migrating bird habitat and disrupt a peaceful community reserve. The Sailability disabled sailing club, which has operated at the site for 26 years, warns it would be forced to close due to safety concerns from ferry traffic. Protesters are calling for the terminal to be relocated to the former Jojo's cafe site in Nedlands, though the government argues the Matilda Bay location provides better access to the University of Western Australia campus.
